intro: Cracca caribaea var. edwardsii, commonly known as the Caribaea nightshade, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It is a member of the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and peppers. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale blue in color. Its leaves are ovate and have a slightly hairy texture, while its fruits are berries that turn from green to red as they mature. This species is often found in tropical and subtropical habitats, growing in moist, well-drained soils.
